Please answer the multiple choice questions below and be aware that you need to carefully read and understand the questions and choose your answers precisely. What does "reciprocal operating privileges" mean for amateur licensees?
A. It allows licensees to operate stations at their home address
B. It allows licensees to operate at any location in the U.S.
C. It allows licensees to operate on a different transmitter on the same freq
D. It allows licensees to operate on a different frequency band

Assistant: This quiz is designed to provide you with an opportunity to test your knowledge of FCC Amateur Radio Rules. Please answer the multiple choice questions below and be aware that you need to carefully read and understand the questions and choose your answers precisely.

What action or actions must you take if the transmitter or antennas you are using are located in the general population density area?
A. Consult with the local governing authorities to determine if a variance in the zoning code is necessary
B. Install a noise reduction antenna, use a noise filter, or take any other suitable measures to reduce radio frequency noise
C. Take steps to suppress power line harmonics, which can disrupt radio communications
D. All these choices are correct

Assistant: If you are unsure about the answers to questions on this quiz, consult the FCC rules (available on the FCC's Web site at https://www.fcc.gov/cgb/rules/) or seek the advice of a local radio amateur who has studied the rules carefully.
